maml:description.maml:para: Signs PowerShell script files with a PFX certificate.

The ConvertTo-SignedScript function signs PowerShell script files (.ps1, .psm1, .psd1) using a specified PFX certificate file. This function validates that the input files are PowerShell scripts and that the certificate file is valid before signing.
The path to one or more PowerShell script files to sign. Accepts pipeline input. Validates that files exist, have valid extensions (.ps1, .psm1, .psd1), and contain content.
The path to the PFX certificate file used for signing. Must be a valid .pfx file that exists and contains data.
The password for the PFX certificate file as a SecureString.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The path to one or more PowerShell script files to sign. Accepts pipeline input. Validates that files exist, have valid extensions (.ps1, .psm1, .psd1), and contain content.
The path to the PFX certificate file used for signing. Must be a valid .pfx file that exists and contains data.
The password for the PFX certificate file as a SecureString.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: The certificate must be valid for code signing and trusted on the system where the scripts will run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Signs the specified PowerShell script with the provided certificate.
Signs all PowerShell scripts in the specified directory using pipeline input.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads the Intune Content Prep Tools from the Microsoft Download Center and extracts the contents to the specified path.
The Get-IntunePackagingTool function downloads the Intune Content Prep Tools from the Microsoft Download Center and extracts the contents to the specified path.
The path to extract the Intune Content Prep Tools to.
{{ Fill DownloadTag Description }}
{{ Fill DownloadUrl Description }}
{{ Fill Force Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The path to extract the Intune Content Prep Tools to.
{{ Fill DownloadTag Description }}
{{ Fill DownloadUrl Description }}
{{ Fill Force Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes an executable file with specified parameters and captures its output.

The Invoke-Executable function runs an executable file with customizable process settings. It provides control over standard output/error redirection, window creation, and shell execution. The function waits for the process to complete and returns the exit code along with any captured output.
The file name or path of the executable to be invoked, including the extension.
Arguments that will be passed to the executable.
Specifies whether standard output should be redirected. Default is $true.
Specifies whether standard error output should be redirected. Default is $true.
Specifies whether to create a new window for the executable. Default is $true.
Specifies whether to use the operating system shell to start the process. Default is $false.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The file name or path of the executable to be invoked, including the extension.
Arguments that will be passed to the executable.
Specifies whether standard output should be redirected. Default is $true.
Specifies whether standard error output should be redirected. Default is $true.
Specifies whether to create a new window for the executable. Default is $true.
Specifies whether to use the operating system shell to start the process. Default is $false.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an object containing the exit code and any standard output/error from the executable.

maml:alert.maml:para: When RedirectStandardOutput or RedirectStandardError is set to $true, UseShellExecute must be $false.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs setup.exe with silent installation parameters.
Runs mytool.exe with a visible window and captures the result.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Application Packaging Framework (APF) deployment package for Intune.

The New-APFDeployment function creates a deployment package that can be used with the Application Packaging Framework to deploy applications to Intune-managed devices. It generates the necessary configuration files and scripts for deploying MSI or EXE installers.
The name of the application. If not provided, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName
The version of the application in the format x.x.x.x. If not provided, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file. Aliases: ApplicationVersion, AppVersion
The target context for the deployment: 'system' or 'user'. Default is 'system'.
The command-line switches to use when installing the application.
The command-line switches to use when uninstalling the application.
The path to the uninstall executable or file.
The path to the installer file (.msi or .exe). This is a mandatory parameter. Aliases: InstallerFile, SourceFile
Paths to any additional files that need to be included in the installation package.
The folder where the files will be copied to. Default is the current directory.
Create a Intune package for the application. Default is false.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the application. If not provided, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName
The version of the application in the format x.x.x.x. If not provided, the script will attempt to extract it from the installer file. Aliases: ApplicationVersion, AppVersion
The target context for the deployment: 'system' or 'user'. Default is 'system'.
The command-line switches to use when installing the application.
The command-line switches to use when uninstalling the application.
The path to the uninstall executable or file.
The path to the installer file (.msi or .exe). This is a mandatory parameter. Aliases: InstallerFile, SourceFile
Paths to any additional files that need to be included in the installation package.
The folder where the files will be copied to. Default is the current directory.
Create a Intune package for the application. Default is false.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Only MSI and EXE installer files are supported.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an APF deployment package for MyApp version 1.0.0.0.
Creates an APF deployment package with custom install and uninstall switches.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates security groups for application deployment in Intune.

The New-ApplicationDeploymentGroups function generates security group names for managing application deployments in Intune. It can create groups for different deployment scenarios (Available, Required, Test, Phase1) and optionally create them in Azure AD or export them to a CSV file.
The name(s) of the application(s) for which to create deployment groups. Multiple names can be provided.
Switch to create the groups in Azure AD.
Switch to export the group list to a CSV file.
The destination folder path for the CSV file when using -CreateFile. Must be a valid container path.
The Administrative Unit ID in Azure AD where groups should be created.
Array of member IDs to add to the Available deployment groups.
Array of member IDs to add to the Required deployment groups.
Array of member IDs to add to the Test deployment groups.
Array of member IDs to add to the Phase1 deployment groups.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name(s) of the application(s) for which to create deployment groups. Multiple names can be provided.
Switch to create the groups in Azure AD.
Switch to export the group list to a CSV file.
The destination folder path for the CSV file when using -CreateFile. Must be a valid container path.
The Administrative Unit ID in Azure AD where groups should be created.
Array of member IDs to add to the Available deployment groups.
Array of member IDs to add to the Required deployment groups.
Array of member IDs to add to the Test deployment groups.
Array of member IDs to add to the Phase1 deployment groups.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: PSObject containing the generated group information.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates security groups in Azure AD for Microsoft 365 Apps deployment.
Generates a CSV file with group names for Adobe Reader and Google Chrome.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Intune application package with all necessary files and configurations.

The New-IntuneApplication function creates a complete Intune application package by generating the required folder structure, copying source files, creating detection scripts, and preparing all necessary configuration files for deployment.
The name of the application to be packaged.
Additional notes about the application.
Path to the application logo image file. Must be a PNG, JPG, or JPEG file.
Specifies the installation context: "User" or "System". Default is "System".
{{ Fill RestartBehavior Description }}
{{ Fill isFeatured Description }}
{{ Fill InstallCommand Description }}
{{ Fill UninstallCommand Description }}
{{ Fill RequirementRuleConfig Description }}
{{ Fill DetectionRuleConfig Description }}
{{ Fill AssignmentType Description }}
Array of paths to the source files that will be included in the application package.
{{ Fill AssignmentGroup Description }}
{{ Fill FilterRuleType Description }}
{{ Fill FilterRule Description }}
{{ Fill IntuneToolsPath Description }}
The filename of the main installer executable or MSI file.
The folder where the application package will be created. Default is the current directory.
A description of the application. Default includes ApplicationName, Publisher, Version, Developer, and notes.
The publisher of the application. Default is the current username.
The version of the application. Default is "1.0".
The developer of the application. Default is the current username.
The owner of the application.
{{ Fill Publish Description }}
{{ Fill Overwrite Description }}
{{ Fill NoJson Description }}
{{ Fill NoIntuneWin Description }}
{{ Fill NoCleanUp Description }}

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or clones a Win32 application in Microsoft Intune.

The New-IntuneWin32Application function creates a new Win32 application in Microsoft Intune or clones an existing application. It supports creating applications from scratch or duplicating existing ones with modified properties using Microsoft Graph API.
The display name of the application.
A description of the application and its purpose.
The version number of the application.
The publisher or vendor of the application.
The owner or responsible party for the application.
The developer or creator of the application.
Additional notes or information about the application.
URL to the application's privacy information or policy.
URL to additional information about the application.
Boolean indicating whether the application should be featured in the Company Portal.

maml:alert.maml:para: Requires PowerShell Core and the Microsoft.Graph.Authentication and Microsoft.Graph.Devices.CorporateManagement modules. Must be connected to Microsoft Graph with appropriate permissions before running this function.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new Win32 application in Intune.
Clones an existing application with a new version.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Intune Win32 application package (.intunewin file) from source files.

The New-IntuneWin32AppPackage function wraps application source files and the main setup file into an encrypted .intunewin package using Microsoft's IntuneWinAppUtil.exe tool. This package can then be uploaded to Microsoft Intune for Win32 app deployment.
The full path to the source folder containing the setup file and all dependency files.
The complete setup file name including extension (e.g., Setup.exe or Installer.msi).
The full path to the output folder where the packaged .intunewin file will be saved.
The full path to the IntuneWinAppUtil.exe file. If not specified or not found, the tool will be automatically downloaded to the temporary folder.
Switch to overwrite an existing .intunewin file if already present in the output folder.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The full path to the source folder containing the setup file and all dependency files.
The complete setup file name including extension (e.g., Setup.exe or Installer.msi).
The full path to the output folder where the packaged .intunewin file will be saved.
Switch to overwrite an existing .intunewin file if already present in the output folder.
The full path to the IntuneWinAppUtil.exe file. If not specified or not found, the tool will be automatically downloaded to the temporary folder.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: The IntuneWinAppUtil.exe tool will be automatically downloaded if not found at the specified path. The source folder should contain all files required for the application installation.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an .intunewin package from the MyApp folder.
Creates an .intunewin package and overwrites any existing package in the output folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a package JSON metadata file for an application deployment.

The New-PackageJSON function generates a JSON file containing package metadata including package name, version, description, author, main installer filename, and a list of all files in the source directory. This metadata file can be used for tracking and deployment purposes.
The name of the application package.
The version number of the package.
A description of the package and its contents.
The author or creator of the package.
The directory path containing the application files to be inventoried.
The filename of the main installer executable or MSI file.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the application package.
The version number of the package.
A description of the package and its contents.
The author or creator of the package.
The directory path containing the application files to be inventoried.
The filename of the main installer executable or MSI file.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Creates a JSON file named "package-{PackageName}-v{Version}.json" in the source directory.

maml:alert.maml:para: The function automatically inventories all files in the source directory and includes them in the JSON metadata.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a JSON metadata file for MyApp in the source directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Publishes an Intune Win32 application package to Microsoft Intune.

The Publish-IntuneAppPackage function uploads a Win32 application package (.intunewin file) along with its configuration JSON to Microsoft Intune. It checks for existing applications and can optionally update them.
The full path to the Intune application configuration JSON file. The file must exist and be a valid file path.
The full path to the .intunewin package file. The file must exist and be a valid file path.
Switch to force update of an existing application in Intune. If not specified, the function will error if the application already exists.
Switch to suppress the display of tenant connection details.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The full path to the Intune application configuration JSON file. The file must exist and be a valid file path.
The full path to the .intunewin package file. The file must exist and be a valid file path.
Switch to force update of an existing application in Intune. If not specified, the function will error if the application already exists.
Switch to suppress the display of tenant connection details.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: PSCustomObject containing information about the published application.

maml:alert.maml:para: Requires connection to Microsoft Graph using Connect-MgGraph before running this function. Requires the Microsoft.Graph.Intune and Microsoft.Graph.Authentication modules.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Publishes the MyApp application to Intune.
Publishes the MyApp application and overwrites if it already exists.
